snippet: The existential question in Beijing remains whether China can simultaneously cut carbon emissions while pursuing strong economic growth.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column; China moves to curb carbon emissions, raising questions about whether it could do so while simultaneously pursuing strong economic growth; fast economic growth is projected to fuel substantial increase in carbon pollution over coming decades, despite improvements in energy efficiency and decarbonization of energy supply.
lead_paragraph: The existential question in Beijing remains whether China can simultaneously cut carbon emissions while pursuing strong economic growth.

headline.main: China’s Hurdle to Fast Action on Climate Change
headline.print_headline: China’s Hurdle to Fast Action on Carbon

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
